intro: Schievereckia, commonly known as the mountain saxifrage, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. These plants are typically found in alpine and subalpine regions, thriving in rocky and well-drained soils. Schievereckia species are characterized by their basal rosettes of leaves and small, clustered flowers that often have five petals. They are adapted to cold climates and can withstand harsh environmental conditions. The genus includes several species, each with unique floral structures and growth habits.
